titleStmt.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to Frederick W. Seward, October 1, 1877

bibl.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to Frederick W. Seward
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
United States Consulate General
Monrovia, Liberia
1st Octo. 1877.

J. Milton Turner
To the
Department of State,
Washington
Transmitting Report for quarter ended 30 Sept. 1877. and explanation of the reason for not sending statement of commerce for the fiscal year of Liberia

No. 1. Register of Official Letters sent
" 2. Do Do Do received
" 3. Statement of Account
" 4. Abstract of Contingent Expenses
" 5. Arrivals and Departures of American Vessels

United States Consulate General,
Monrovia, Liberia
1st Octo. 1877.
I have the honor to transmit herewith my Report for the quarter ended 30th Sept. 1877.

I regret that I am compelled by the difficulties attendant upon the collection of facts and figures necessary to ascertain the commerce at state
Honorable
F. W. Seward,
Asst. Secretary of State,
Washington
state and relations of Liberia for the fiscal year (which closes, in this country, on the 30th of September) to delay my report thereof for some days. However, I hope to have the honor to forward a statement upon that subject at an early day.
The 30th of September having occured on a Sunday, my Report bears date as above.

I have to be,
Sir,
Your obedient servant
J. Milton Turner
